What tips would you give so that you can gain rep fairly and rapidly.

Don't seek rep, as Starwhip says it's valueless. Just do what you enjoy in KSP and if people dig it they will rep.

Don't seek rep, as Starwhip says it's valueless. Just do what you enjoy in KSP and if people dig it they will rep.

(Please understand this post is meant in an honest way and is not meant to be offensive or rude, I thank you for your advice, this is just my thoughts on them).

I could try to do those things. I don't want to cheat my rep up, since your rep is a mix of your forum achievements and such. It shouldn't be cheated. However it does show how big of the community you are, and tbh I think I'm *decently* large (I'm not Whackjob, but I'm more known that some users). So I felt that my rep doesn't properly do me justice. I feel I should have at least 1 light green bar.

I could post everywhere but there are few threads that actually interest me. I could post everywhere but that would be spam I won't gain rep that way. Moreover my posts aren't that funny (I'm not that a funny person ), and although I'm smart, I'm not smart enough to gain merit for my posts. I could help people with some scientific issues, but the ones I understand enough to make a strong enough post in, only pop up once a month. I've hosted events, plans, and collaborative projects but most don't get off the ground (nor gain attention or rep). It seems I gain 1 rep every 2-3 months. At this rate, it'll take me 3 more years and I'll have 25,000 posts. At which point I should deserve more than 1 light green bar.

Lastly, I've done pretty much everything you've mentioned (that's within my range of feasibility) and the ones I haven't done I'll try. But I've made stories/fan fictions before. I'm the founder of the 2nd largest rocket building company. I am running an external RP forum (which has stalled and needs a reboot). I've made jokes and been a happy guy since day 1, and more importantly I attempted to lead a academy for new players (which also stalled) and I've been helping people as much as I could.

Tl;dr -

I've done most of your suggestions... I just want my rep to match my true REP as a member of this community. I don't want the most, I don't want least. I just want I deserve.

People don't tend to rep routine posts, even ones that are funny or helpful. Posts that provide something valuable to other forumgoers (like a good craft or a useful mod) or show off a unique feat you've accomplished in the game are the ones that people will think to rep. My rep really took off when I started making comics (read them in the links below! Rep the pages that make you smile! [/shameless]) When I started, no one had really told a story in dedicated graphic novel form before--and people repped the heck out of it because it was unique. These days I have to work a bit harder: a comic page is no longer unique, but my best pages will still get a fair amount of rep. And look what I just said there -- "work a bit harder". I've said before that I find getting rep and reader comments very motivational for making better comics. If I post a page and no one reacts to it, I know that I need to do better. When I post something and the next 2 pages on the thread are filled with reader discussion, and maybe I get a few +reps too, then I know I did good.

TL;dr--Look at the top names on this list. Go to the 'reputation' tab in their profiles and see what they are getting rep for. I guarantee it's for giving the other members here something unique and awesome. Go do something unique and awesome.

And ETA: I see that you're doing many of these things as you explained in a followup post. Sorry. All I can say is keep doing them if it makes you happy. If doing the things does not make you happy then do not do the things, rep or no rep.

I enjoy most of the things I have posted, hence why I post them. But it is a major buzzkill to the drive of making those things when I get 150 views, and effectively is born and died without ever being known. Which is the story for most of my "unique" attempts (external RP forum, fanfics, academies,etc). So I'm less tempted to make or share these things when I gain no attention (never mind rep- since it will come with the success of the thread).

Guys it really doesn't matter.. If people wont rep you so what? Do you play KSP and use the forum so you can collect this valueless thing? I hope not, and imagine that's not the case. So just enjoy the game man, and be as helpful as you can on the forum.

Cheers.

If there's any advice that I could give you, once you've achieved your goal of Light Green Group... What's next? There's nothing much to it after that.

But if you want it, here's what I think:

So what if nobody cares about your amazing replica that you built for months? If there's anything I learned, it's that even in the times that you get frustrated at people (and get an extreme temptation to flame them,) or you're annoyed that people just ignored your marvelous creation, keep your chin up. Work harder! Someway, it will find it's way back to you. I'm pretty sure every builder has gone through moments when their ship was totally disregarded or (maybe they don't care, sometimes I don't ) the more common, 0 replies, 0 notifications.

It's important to stay persevering in these situations. Who knows? Maybe you have a unique skill in.. building? (Take Majorjim and Rune) Perhaps mod-making? (NathanKell, ferram4) Or even just being a good and honest poster (..Maybe regex falls under this?).

..Your move, best of luck. (Even if it doesn't have any benefit, really xD)
